page.title: 09TOURISM Windmill
page.content: {Heckington Windmill { Heckington mill is the only eight sailed windmill in England.The person who built it was John Nash who is buried in Heckington churchyard.In the mill there is a ground floor,a stone floor,a second stone floor,a bin floor and the cap.It has five floors altogether.The stairs are normal to begin with but as you get higher up they become steeper.The grindstones are stones with ridges in them to grind the flour.The ground flour goes down a chute to a big bin which is where they fill the bags.The cap is where the gears are to turn the grindstones.There is also a ring type cog which runs round the cap.It turns the cap round when the small fantail is turned. The mill's shutters,stones and bins are being repaired.
